page.title: 09 Ecology
page.content: Intensive farming is causing problems leakage of slurry,liquor from silage are highly toxic,polluting rivers. Ill effects from artificial fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides a problem, long term damage is not known this worries those concerned for an healthy environment. Source of radioactivity has been detected in granite rocks on moorland. Houses built of this have levels unacceptable to government who plan to inforce building restrictions. Many hedges have been removed and this threatens our landescape.Farmers are heeding the ecologists,saplings are left to grow, some planting is going on.Since the invention of the {Flail {Hedge Trimmer}farmers have preferred continuous low hedges with no trees. Attempts made to establish an {Otter {Sanctuary}and breeding site for birds of prey on{Bolesbridge}river.
